title: JSON Format
description: Learn how to use JSON format for help articles
content:
JSON Format

JSON (JavaScript Object Notation) is a structured data format that's perfect for articles with complex metadata.

This article is written in JSON (.json) format.

What is JSON?

JSON is a lightweight data interchange format that's easy for humans to read and write, and easy for machines to parse and generate.

Advantages

  • Structured: Clear separation of metadata and content
  • Flexible: Support for complex data structures
  • Familiar: Widely used across web development
  • Validated: Can be validated with JSON Schema

JSON Article Structure

{
  "slug": "article-slug",
  "title": "Article Title",
  "description": "Brief description",
  "category": "category-id",
  "tags": ["tag1", "tag2"],
  "content": "HTML content here"
}

When to Use JSON

  • Articles with rich metadata
  • Content that needs to be programmatically generated
  • Integration with APIs or databases
  • Complex data structures
